results.title: Athletes (Italian)
results.brief_description: The growth of track and field competition in Australia is studied, junior events as well as international competitions. We see the work being done to encourage youngsters to participate in track and field events. The film contains some very excellent slow motion sequences of athletes performing at their peak, which evoke a strange sort of fluid beauty in this otherwise rather harsh world of sweat and strain.

results.title: Athlete: hurdles
results.creator_credit: John Dobson, BBC-TV and John Rickword
results.brief_description: Members of the Great Britain Olympic Squad of 1972 demonstrate the techniques of hurdling, then young athletes practise these techniques. Illustrates the analysis and correction of common faults.

results.title: Athens and the Greek Spirit
results.creator_credit: Frank Gorin, Britta Halling and Calcon
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Tour bustling Plaka, just below the Acropolis. Watch the changing of the guard outside the Parliament building, then tour the Academy. A view of the Greek Islands - tour the Acropolis and marvel at the Parthenon.

results.title: Athens and ancient Greece
results.brief_description: Ancient Greece and 25 of the most significant structures and monuments, as originally built, come alive as Greek customs and daily life are revealed through computer graphics, archival film and classic art. Tour the Acropolis in the 5th century B.C., gaze at the State of Athena and the Parthenon, the pride and joy of the Athenians. Walk the Agora, Theatre of Dionysius (home of the Olympic Games) and the Temple of Zeus. Stand before Delphis Temple of Apollo where the oracle spoke. Travel to Mycenae, City of Agamemnon; Santorini and Atlantis, the legendary lost continent.

results.title: Ataturk: the rise of the Turkish Republic (Turkish Version)
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel, Sim Productions and Marianna Norris
results.brief_description: Presents the history of the Turkish people and the role of Ataturk in its rise to nationhood in the twentieth century. Narration is in the Turkish language.

results.title: Ataturk: father of modern Turkey
results.creator_credit: Burton Benjamin and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
Explains how, at the end of World War I, Mustapha Kemal Ataturk took over government and began to Westernise the country. Discusses the various projects he started.

results.title: At your service
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the process of the manufacture of ball bearings by the famous Swedish firm of S.K.F. The firm has its own mines and steel works and carries the manufacturing processes right through to the finished product. For commercial uses some 8,000 different types and sizes are produced, in addition special precision ball bearings with an accuracy to 1,000,000 in. are produced for use in precision instruments.
